intro: Rubia argyi var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy Chinese madder, is a perennial herb native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its roots are used in traditional medicine and as a natural dye source. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
